definition: the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑線上，我們都是膽小者。

sentences.english: and start the race at the same starting line.
sentences.chinese: 然後在同一起跑線開始賽跑。

sentences.english: At the whistle, players throw themselves forwards from the starting line like arrows.
sentences.chinese: 隨着一聲哨響，選手們都箭一般地衝出了起跑線。

sentences.english: He pulled off his race number and headed to the tunnel behind the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 他扯下了比賽號碼向起跑線後方的通道走去。

sentences.english: So a starting line was made, and away they went.
sentences.chinese: 他們劃了條起跑線，出發了。

sentences.english: Open open teaching time, let your child win on the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 開啓智教時期，讓孩子贏正在起跑線。

sentences.english: Everyone starts from the same starting line.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都從同一個起跑線開始。

sentences.english: This should be China to rush toward mankind's civilization new mileage of rise run line.
sentences.chinese: 這應該是中國奔向人類文明新里程的起跑線。

sentences.english: The runners got into position the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑運動員友進褥起跑線上賭位幟。

sentences.english: In short, the DOE is starting from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 簡而言之，能源部又回到了起跑線。

sentences.english: What is the starting line like?
sentences.chinese: 或者，起跑線是什麼樣的？

sentences.english: They were at the starting line and all set to begin.
sentences.chinese: 他們都在起跑線上，隨時可開始。

sentences.english: And if there are inhibitions on that starting line, you're not going to do a good job.
sentences.chinese: 從起跑線就有了禁忌，你就幹不好。

sentences.english: I sometimes nant to have a time when.
sentences.chinese: 在愛的起跑線上，我都很小心的走好每一步。

definition: unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
